Package it.unimol.monopoly.app

Class Player

java.lang.Object
it.unimol.monopoly.app.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Class that defines the Player object, one of the most important ones, because it allows the execution of all those methods which require the need of a player. In fact, this class is strictly linked to almost all the others. Every player is composed of a name, an ID, a quantity of money, a list of owned contracts, the number of owned contracts, and a boolean variable that indicates if a player is prisoner or not. Each player gets added to the map inside the PlayerManager. It implements the Serializable interface because the state of every player is saved on a file.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Angelo Trotta

    static int
    aux
    Counter variable of support to both this and other classes, used to dynamically increment the IDs of each player the moment they are created, starting from 0, and manage them at best in collaboration with other classes, avoiding possible exceptions or unexpected events during the game.

      Parameters:

    • rollDice

      public void rollDice()
      Method used in the RollForm so that each player can throw a die before starting their turn. It implements the logic of throwing dice. A die has six faces, so a player can advance from 1 to 6 boxes. Once exceeded the number of boxes inside the PositionManager, the player passes through the Start and, if necessary, continues their movement.

    • isPoor

      public boolean isPoor()
      It checks if a player has money.
      Returns:
      true if the player has an empty bank account, false otherwise.
